name: St Julien Hotel and Spa

reviews.title: Luxury and Location
reviews.text: Loved this hotel! I wish they would have had this hotel for my parents to stay in when I went to CU. My family and I had connecting rooms and the beds were great! Stand up shower was incredible. Valet service great! My only reason to not give it a 5 star was twice our service in the bar was below par. I would for sure come back and take the bar with a grain of salt.

reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in great location
reviews.text: Just finish my second stay at the St. Julien hotel - the first was a few years ago. Both trips were business. It was even more lovely than I remembered. The staff were all wonderful - from the bell man to the receptionist, to the room cleaners, and all the wait staff. Everyone was awesome!

reviews.title: Luxury Hotel in CO hotspot
reviews.text: I stayed there as part of a small conference with 30 colleagues - and we all had a wonderful time. We shared a few meals (2 breakfasts and two dinners) and all the food was great.

reviews.title: If you're in Boulder, CO it's the ONLY place to stay
reviews.text: Sadly I had no time at all to enjoy the spa but a few of my colleagues did and raved about it as well.

reviews.title: Very posh
reviews.text: Boulder is a great small city with so much to offer but I hardly wanted to explore it as I was enjoying my stay at the hotel so much.

We have been staying at the St Julien for what is now 7 years. This makes it our most visited from a large list of hotels. It is everything we want in a Boutique hotel stay. Nicely appointed rooms, fun atmosphere and friendly, hospitable staff.
reviews.title: Our 8th or 9th stay

reviews.text: We have never had a bad stay. The caliber of the accommodations and service had never wavered. Even when something is not right, they go out of their way to make it so.
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kudos to the management for maintaining a high standard.
reviews.title: Recharge in Boulder
Best in Boulder
reviews.text: Stayed here for four nights while attending a conference. Nice hotel with largish rooms, stone bathrooms, and very comfortable beds. One block from Pearl St, which has a large assortment of restaurants and shops. Service was very good, and value was excellent, although we did get a conference rate. I stayed here for business but if I come back for a vacation with my wife this is where I will stay.

Absolutely beautiful spot near Pearl Street mall. I felt refreshed and recharged after two nights. Near great restaurants and Boulder Creek trail. Great friendly staff, well appointed rooms, excellent fitness facilities, and great restaurant. Spa looks very good as well. I'll give that a try on my next visit here.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel but needs a better housekeeping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the St. Julien after moving my daughter into CU dorms. My husband never stayed there and so I wanted him to see what it was all about because all he has done is complain how much it is to stay there. Well, he was in awe!! He doesn't want to stay anywhere else for future visits. We booked through I Prefer and so you get perks like later check out and upgrade in room if available so we did get a balcony room. Service as always was top notch. Love the in and out valet of the car. Ordered room service twice, it was good and quick. Overall great customer service for our stay!! We had the most amazing couples massage at the Spa with champaign right after. We will be back, can't say enough about this hotel. It is the best in Boulder!
reviews.title: Always the best - Again!

reviews.text: Had a business meeting here and wow, what an introduction to Boulder! St. Julien is conveniently located within walking distance to many attractions. It's also a beautiful place to be if you don't want to do anything away from the hotel. The staff is extremely friendly and eager to assist. The bathrooms are huge and luxurious. Overall, just a great hotel!
reviews.title: Wonderful property and location

reviews.text: The St Julien is my number 1 choice for a stay in Boulder. I love the location, interior design (slate tiles and muted colors), the indoor pool, and the most comfortable beds. Book early because this hotel often sells out during certain University of Colorado events.
reviews.title: Always a good night's sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every time you leave the hotel and return you are greeted by name - it is this kind of service that is everywhere in the hotel. We stayed over a weekend and enjoyed the bar, the restaurant and our room! We left to explore and were always pleased upon retuning to such warm welcomes. Nice rooms - great bathrooms! All beautiful and the location great!
reviews.title: Great Service
Excellent hotel
reviews.text: I'm just wrapping up a three night stay at St. Julien for a work conference. The hotel is very nicely appointed and in an excellent location - lots of stuff within walking distance. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the service is outstanding. The staff is really friendly and helpful. I've had breakfast at Jill's every morning. They have a variety of options; even for vegetarians. The service there was consistently good. They also offer bikes for a morning ride through the bike paths. I didn't do this personally, but heard it was nice. Something I'll definitely check out next time I stay here. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for work or vacation.

reviews.title: Terrific but what's with the pillows?
reviews.text: This is a great place to stay, in the heart of the historical district, just a block from Pearl St where there are a ton of good restaurants and shops. The people here are very nice (like everyone in Boulder...what's to not be happy about?) Rooms aren't huge but very nice. The pillows were all bumps and rocks, which was amazing given how good everything else was.

reviews.title: An Amazing Hotel and Spa!
reviews.text: Excellent staff, location, room, everything! Special thanks to Kristi at the Spa. I've had many massages in my life, but this was amazing! She was so caring, strong, sensitive and found the exact points on my body that were causing challenges. What a jewel !

reviews.title: Best Hotel in Boulder
reviews.text: Great location with views of the Flatirons from the courtyard. The patio has great atmosphere and it's a pleasure to linger there in the evenings for a drink and music provided several evenings during the week. The food is delectable and many healthy optiosn are available; service is flawless.

reviews.title: Wish we could've stayed longer!!
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious with natural tile showers and whirlpool tubs. Bath amenities are from their spa and quality products. The hotel is within walking distance of Pearl Street Mall and close to many good restaurants. The rooms facing Walnut Street can get loud at night with the music from the surrounding bars and restaurants. The spa is upscale (and expensive), but I highly recommend it.

reviews.title: Very good location and service
reviews.text: Drawbacks: There is no free parking close to the hotel and the garage or valet parking is expensive. The St. Julien is the best hotel for business and leisure travel in Boulder.
